channel.title: Building my computer
channel.description:
So, it arrived, 1.5 business days after I ordered it.
The case is huge compared to my Dell B110, but that's really no comparison.
It's been outside in the snow for half a day, so I'll let it sit for at least an hour before I do some inspection.
Any tips, precautions, advice for putting it together?
Here's the list of parts: https://secure.newegg.com/NewVersion/WishList/PublicWishDetail.asp?WishListNumber=7786888

item.title: Building my computer
item.dc:creator: @swordskid61 Swordskid61
item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:13, topic:162766”][quote author=Swordskid61 link=topic=221343.msg1918120#msg1918120 date=1197066285]

My PC > Yours

Lol, Just make sure you route the cables properly, thats one of the most common mistakes in a computer build.

It’s up and running, meaning I finished installing XP.

Ew XP. Why Not Vista? Home Premium Is Pretty Nice

[/quote]

http://www.anandtech.com/systems/showdoc.aspx?i=2917&p=19[/quote]
i haves home basic i there a way to downgrade to XP? w/o paying

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @swordskid61 Swordskid61
item.description:
@swordskid61 wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:11, topic:162766”][quote author=RXVL link=topic=221343.msg1917954#msg1917954 date=1197048416]
My PC > Yours

Lol, Just make sure you route the cables properly, thats one of the most common mistakes in a computer build.
[/quote]

It’s up and running, meaning I finished installing XP.[/quote]

Ew XP. Why Not Vista? Home Premium Is Pretty Nice

item.title: Building my computer
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:8, topic:162766”]My PC > Yours

Lol, Just make sure you route the cables properly, thats one of the most common mistakes in a computer build.[/quote]

It’s up and running, meaning I finished installing XP.

Bang Train:

out of curiosity did your mobo come with a static bracelet?

Nope. Just touch the [metal] case often and you shouldn’t have a problem.

[quote=“Greeny, post:10, topic:162766”]Rule one: No static, don’t build it on a carpet and tap something earthed every 10 minutes.
Rule two: CPUs reach a 100Deg C in a seconds, Make sure you have paste and heatsink attatched securely to the CPU before the first time you power up. (also make sure the heatsink fan has power and is spinning). If not CUT the power immediately.

Good luck.[/quote]

I built it already. The thermal paste came on the heatsink, so I really didn’t have to do anything difficult.

Read full topic

item.title: Building my computer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Rule one: No static, don’t build it on a carpet and tap something earthed every 10 minutes.
Rule two: CPUs reach a 100Deg C in a seconds, Make sure you have paste and heatsink attatched securely to the CPU before the first time you power up. (also make sure the heatsink fan has power and is spinning). If not CUT the power immediately.

Good luck.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:7, topic:162766”]No one FUCKING helped me here, but I don’t need you anyway.

As of now, my computer is up and running beautifully. I’ll set up pictures soon.[/quote]
out of curiosity did your mobo come with a static bracelet?
